page.title: 09Housing
page.content: There is a wide diversity of housing in our block. Due to the land being primarily agricultural land there are obviosly a large number of farm houses. Other housing in the area varies from cottage terrace, built about 1840, to Â£superior dwellings' built within the last year. In our survey it was discovered that the majority of residents had lived in the area for less than 20 years. This is undoubtadly due to the building of the Rainford Junction Estate.This estate consists mainly of semi-detached dormer bungalow design. Most of the older cottage terrace property is situated along Bushey Lane, which is the main road through the Junction. The Bickerstaffe area offers the widest variety. Of particular interest is an old windmill converted into a luxory home.
